title: 109_hr961
content: The "Social Security Fairness Act of 2005" is cited as the short title. Section 202 of the Social Security Act is amended to include a new subsection regarding the termination of monthly insurance benefits upon death. The "Social Security Fairness Act of 2005" amends Section 202 of the Social Security Act to adjust monthly insurance benefits for individuals who die within the first 15 days of a month. The amount paid is 50 percent of the benefit, rounded up to the next dollar. This adjustment applies after all other benefit adjustments have been made. Additionally, payments for the month of death are made according to section 204(d). Section 223 of the Act is also amended to include new subsections related to disability insurance benefits. Exemption from maximum benefit cap is granted for individuals receiving benefits under certain sections upon their death. Additionally, there is an increase in lump-sum death payments. Section 202(i) of the Social Security Act is amended to update the applicable dollar amount for lump-sum death payments to $970 annually, with adjustments made by the Commissioner of Social Security after 2005. The Security shall determine and publish the applicable dollar amount for the next calendar year in the Federal Register by November 1. The amount is calculated based on the national average wage index ratio for the previous year compared to the index for 2004, rounded to the nearest multiple of $5.00. The amendments made by this Act will be effective for deaths occurring after 90 days from the enactment date.
